intro: Ruellia acaulis, commonly known as the stemless ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Ruellia acaulis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
